source (en_US):
Hi in this video, let us learn
 about Privacy Mode in detail.
translation (nl): 1. "Hallo, in deze video gaan we meer leren over Privacymodus in detail."

source (en_US): What is Privacy Mode?

A feature offered by the Driverâ€¢i device
 to respect the privacy
 of drivers and passengers.
translation (nl): 3. "Een functie aangeboden door het Driver•i-Apparaat om de Privacy van bestuurders en passagiers te respecteren."

source (en_US):
When the vehicle is not moving,
 the decision about inward camera
 recording is provided to them.
translation (nl): 4. "Wanneer het voertuig niet beweegt, wordt de beslissing over opname met de binnenwaartse camera aan hen overgelaten."

source (en_US):
In most cases,
 this feature is applicable only
 for the Driverâ€¢i devices where
 inward camera recording is enabled.
translation (nl): 5. "In de meeste gevallen is deze functie alleen van toepassing op de Driver•i-Apparaten waarbij opname met de binnenwaartse camera is ingeschakeld."

source (en_US):
When this feature is activated,
 the inward video files will not be stored
 in the device and the video
 file cannot be retrieved.
translation (nl): 6. "Wanneer deze functie is geactiveerd, worden de binnenwaartse video-bestanden niet opgeslagen in het apparaat en kan het video-bestand niet worden opgehaald."

source (en_US): Enabling or Disabling Privacy Mode
Privacy Mode is enabled when the vehicle speed reaches
translation (nl): 8. "Privacymodus wordt ingeschakeld wanneer de Voertuigsnelheid de waarde bereikt van"

source (en_US):
zero miles per hour for three minutes
 or when the vehicle ignition is off.
translation (nl): 9. "nul Miles per hour gedurende drie minuten of wanneer de Ontstekingsstatus van het voertuig uit is."

source (en_US):
When the Privacy Mode is enabled,
 a black screen appears in place
translation (nl): 10. "Wanneer de Privacymodus is ingeschakeld, verschijnt er een zwart scherm in plaats van"

source (en_US):
of Inward Camera View in the alert videos
 in the Driverâ€¢i portal
 or in the Driverâ€¢i app.
translation (nl): 11. "de binnenwaartse cameraweergave in de Waarschuwingsvideo's in het Driver•i-Portaal of in de Driver•i App."

source (en_US):
Privacy Mode is disabled as soon as
 the vehicle ignition is on and the vehicle
 speed reaches 5 mph or more.
translation (nl): 12. "Privacymodus wordt uitgeschakeld zodra de ontsteking van het voertuig aan staat en de Voertuigsnelheid 5 mph of meer bereikt."

source (en_US):
Let us see how Privacy Mode
 works in different scenarios.
translation (nl): 13. "Laten we kijken hoe Privacymodus werkt in verschillende scenario's."

source (en_US):
Scenario 1 Driver stops the vehicle
 and turns the ignition to the off
 or Accessory auxiliary position.
translation (nl): 14. "Scenario 1: bestuurder stopt het voertuig en zet de ontsteking in de uit-stand of de Accessory Auxillary-stand."

source (en_US):
Privacy Mode will be enabled a few seconds
 after ignition is turned to the off or
 except Accessory auxiliary position.
translation (nl): 15. "Privacymodus wordt ingeschakeld enkele seconden nadat de ontsteking naar de uit-stand of de Accessory Auxillary-stand is gedraaid."

source (en_US):
Scenario 2 Driver stops the vehicle for an
 extended time and leaves the ignition on.
translation (nl): 16. "Scenario 2: bestuurder stopt het voertuig voor langere tijd en laat de ontsteking aan staan."

source (en_US):
Privacy Mode will be
 enabled after three minutes.

Scenario 3
 Driver stops the vehicle and turns
 the ignition off, then turns the ignition
 back on,
translation (nl): 18. "Scenario 3: bestuurder stopt het voertuig en zet de ontsteking uit, en zet de ontsteking vervolgens weer aan,"

source (en_US): for example to run accessory or heater.
translation (nl): 19. "bijvoorbeeld om een Accessory of de verwarming te gebruiken."

source (en_US):
Privacy Mode will already be enabled
 and will remain enabled since
 the vehicle hasn't moved.

The video is blacked out for the entire
 duration since the ignition was off.

Scenario 4 Driver turns
 the ignition on and resumes driving.

Privacy Mode will be disabled a few
 seconds after the vehicle ignition is
 turned on and the vehicle
 speed exceeds 5 mph.

How to know when Privacy Mode is activated
 on the Portal Navigate to the
 Event Access page on the Portal.

Click on any completed video request
 for the videos where
 Privacy Mode is activated.
Inward Facing Camera View is disabled.

Hovering over the Inward facing camera
 view displays the message
 Privacy Mode Activated.

This indicates that Privacy Mode
 was activated during that event.

How to configure Privacy Mode
 on the Portal Privacy Mode can be
 enabled or disabled from the portal.

To configure the Privacy Mode
 in the Portal, navigate
 to Provisioning and Configurations.
In the side menu, click Configurations.
Click Privacy Mode.

Under Camera Settings,
 you can see the current status
 of Privacy Mode as enabled or disabled.
Click Edit.

Privacy Mode is enabled as
 the default configuration.

Select Disabled to disable
 the Privacy Mode.

If the Privacy Mode is disabled,
 select Enabled or select

the Use System Default Configurations
 button to enable the Privacy Mode.

Review the configuration and click
 Save to save the new configuration.
Hi! In this video, let us look at the Dashboard screen of the Driverâ€¢i App in detail.

The Driverâ€¢i App allows you to
 see driving behaviors identified by the

Driverâ€¢i device and the
 corresponding driver score.

The app also opens communication between
 you and your manager through the sharing
 of video, comments and feedback.

You can download the app
 from Google Play Store or
 the Apple App Store, depending
 on the type of phone you are using.

The cameras on the Driverâ€¢i device record
 all the driving events as they happen.

These events include sign violations,
 speeding violations,

seatbelt non compliance,
 distracted driving,

as well as proactive driving events such
 as creating space for vehicles
 merging or parked on the shoulder.

Events are categorized into moderate risk,
 severe risk,
or DriverStars Proactive Safe Driving.

The device analyzes these driving events
 to generate alerts that are played either

as an audio message inside the vehicle or
 as a video that is uploaded to the portal.

Your manager can view the alerts that you
 have generated and add them
 to your coaching session if needed.

Logging into the App
 Reach out to your safety manager to get
 your credentials to log into the app.

Open the Driverâ€¢i app,
 enter your username and tap login.
Enter the password and Tap Login.

After the password is authenticated,
 you will be logged in to the Driverâ€¢i app.

Forgot or Reset Password
 Enter the username on the login
 screen and tap Forgot Password.

Tap Send Password reset Email
 A Reset Password link is sent
 to your registered email address.

Click or tap the Reset Password link
 in the email on the Reset Password screen.
Enter a new password and confirm the same.
Tap Reset Password.
The password is reset.

You will be directed to the login
 screen to log in with the new password.

Change Password
 log into the Driverâ€¢i app and tap
 the menu option on the top left corner.

Tap Change Password,
 enter values in the old password,

New Password and Confirm Password
 fields and tap Change Password.
The password is changed.

You must now use the new password
 to log into the Driverâ€¢i app.

Benefits of Driverâ€¢i app
 the Driverâ€¢i app will benefit you in the
 following visibility in your performance.
The mystery of the camera is removed.

You can view your Green Zone score,
 most impactful alerts,
 your rank, and DriverStars.

Weekly review sessions
 gain awareness of impactful driving
 behaviors affecting your score,
 know where you stand,

view your ranking in the fleet,
 and understand how you can improve your
 rank by avoiding high impact events.

Features of Driverâ€¢i app
 Let's see a quick overview of
 various sections of the app.

App Tour provides a guided walkthrough
 of the app and and helps you
 understand how the app works.

FAQs provides answers to frequently
 asked questions about the app features, GreenZone score alerts, etc.

Dashboard screen displays your GreenZone
 score, DriverStars and alerts that have
 impacted your Green Zone score.

Events Screen displays detailed
 information about the number of alerts
 generated and DriverStar
 is awarded weekly.

Review screen displays the three alerts
 that have been assigned for coaching based
 on driving behavior in the past week.

GreenZone Screen displays your GreenZone
 score and the list of high impact
 events that affected your score.

For more details, tap the floating Help
 icon to view the help content relevant
 to the tab that is open on your screen.

Hi! In this video, let us look at the
 Dashboard screen of the
 Driverâ€¢i App in detail.

The Dashboard screen provides a summary
 of your driving performance

based on the alerts and DriverStars
 generated by you.

This screen helps you analyze your
 strengths and areas of improvement.

Tap the daily, weekly,
 and monthly buttons to view

the corresponding information
 on the Dashboard screen.

You can also select the required date,
 week or month using
 the left and right arrows.

The following information is
 displayed on the Dashboard screen.

Your Green Zone score is based
 on the alerts, driver Stars and neutral
 events that you generated while driving.

Generating alerts will
 impact your Green Zone score.

Tap the arrow in this section to navigate
 to the Green Zone screen and view details

about the events that impacted
 your Green Zone score.

Your rank is determined based on the
 Green Zone score of your fellow drivers.

This is to encourage a healthy
 competition in the fleet.

You can view your rank among
 all drivers in your fleet.

Three drivers with topmost Green Zone
 score are displayed
 on the Dashboard screen.

This is a fleet based configuration,
 hence the ranking card is displayed only
 if the feature is enabled for the fleet.

DriverStars are awarded
 to recognize safe driving behavior.

DriverStars have a positive
 impact on your GreenZone score.

Total Alerts Generated displays the total
 number of alerts generated
 by you in the selected duration.

Average following Distance denotes
 the average distance that you maintained

between your vehicle and the vehicle
 ahead that is also in the same lane.

Total Minutes Analyzed displays the amount
 of time in minutes you drove the vehicle,

including the time when vehicle
 was switched on but not moving.

You will receive notifications about
 weekly review sessions, alerts and
 comments shared by your safety manager.

You can view these notifications
 by tapping the bell icon
 on the top right corner.

When you tap the vertical ellipsis
 on the top right corner

of the notifications screen,
 you can see the following Mark all as Read
 show unread only for more details.

Tap the floating Help icon
 on the screen to view the help content.

Hi! In this video,
 let us look at the weekly review

Tap Weekly Review at the bottom
 of the screen.

 the coaching sessions that have been

The system analyzes your
 driving behavior
 and assigns three alert videos

that will

 score

and the potential score you could have

The Events screen displays your most

Time Period
 On the Events screen,

Search

The Events screen displays two
 alerts and DriverStars .

the top three alerts among those that you

You can narrow down your search results

tapping the Filters icon located next

You can filter the alerts based

Select the All Alerts checkbox if you want

Otherwise, you can select the required

Filter the alerts based on Risk Level
 by selecting the

Severe Alerts or Moderate Alerts

Filter alerts based on video availability

Video Available Indicates that the video
 has been received from the device
 and is available for viewing.

Video Requested Indicates that the video
 is not available at present to be viewed

Once you raise the request,

 available for you to view.

Video on Request indicates that the video
 is not available and not yet requested.
You can request it if required.

Video Unavailable Indicates that the video
 is no longer available
 and cannot be requested.

Show Only select the options to see only
 bookmarked alerts or not viewed alerts.

Sort by Date Toggle the ascending or
 descending buttons to sort
 the alerts by date as required.

The DriverStars tab displays the
 Most frequent DriverStars section

displays the top three driver stars
 that were awarded to you
 in the selected duration.

Shared Driver Stars section displays
 the driver stars shared
 with you by your Safety manager.

You can narrow down your search results
 to view exactly what you want by tapping
 the Filters icon located next
 to Shared Driver Stars Filters.

You can filter the alerts based
 on the following:

Filter Alerts based on video availability
 by selecting the Following Video Available

Video Requested Video
 on Request Video Unavailable

Show Only select the options to see only
 bookmarked alerts or or not viewed alerts.

Sort by date Toggle the ascending or
 descending buttons to sort
 the DRiverStars by date as required.

For more details, tap the floating
 Help icon to view the help content.
Hi in this video, let us look at the coaching screen of the Driverâ€¢i app Safety Manager View in detail

Coaching is an integral part
 in maintaining and promoting
 safe driving behavior in drivers.

When coaching sessions are conducted
 at regular intervals, drivers show
 improved safe driving performance.

The Coaching screen of the Driverâ€¢i app
 provides detailed information about

the pending and completed coaching
 sessions of drivers in the fleet.

Tap the search icon on the top right
 corner of the screen and type the required

keywords such as Session ID or driver name
 to search for the required
 coaching session.

The Pending tab displays the coaching
 sessions that are yet to be
 completed by the driver.

The completed tab displays all the
 completed coaching sessions by the driver.

The Coaching Sessions card displays
 the session id,

total number of alerts,
 name of the driver, the date and time when

the session was created, and the most
 frequent alerts generated by the driver.

Coaching Session Details
 Tap the green arrow on the card to view
details of the coaching session.
This screen displays the number of alerts,
DriverStars, Notifications, Recognitions,

and frequent alerts generated by the
 driver since the last coaching session.

Bookmarked Events Displays the important
 events that you have bookmarked for future

reference
 Events added to Coaching Displays all

the alerts added to a coaching session
 session Discussion Allows you to add any

comments or remarks from the discussion
 you had with the driver
 during the coaching session.

Add Conclusion Notes Allows you to add
 closing notes after the coaching session is completed,

you must first select one
 of the reasons from the drop down list.

Select adjustments made to route if
 the driver's route is changed or updated

based on any challenges
 that the driver may be facing.

Select Driver Assigned Training if
 the driver drivers enrolled for some specific training program,'
Select Coaching Completed if the driver completed the coaching session,

the Mark as Complete button must be tapped
 after the coaching session is complete.

Coaching Session Configurations
 Tap the settings icon on the top right

corner to display the Coaching
 session configuration screen.

You can configure the coaching sessions
 based on the following
Select All Drivers or All Drivers Except
or Only These Drivers to create automated
coaching sessions for drivers as required.

Select the required alert types depending
 on the risk level to create automated

coaching sessions only
 for the selected alert type.
After making the required selections, tap Save to save the changes made for configuration.
Tap the floating Help icon on the bottom-right corner of the screen to view the Help content.

Hi! Let us see how safety managers can
 provide feedback on the Driverâ€¢i app.

User feedback provides valuable insights
 that show areas
 of improvement in the product.
This can help improve user experience.

You can suggest an improvement or report
 an issue by selecting a feature
 from the predefined Features list.

To provide feedback on the app,
 tap the menu icon on the top
 left corner of the screen.
Tap Feedback.
The feedback screen is displayed.

Tap check FAQs to check if your issue was
 already reported
and a solution was proposed.
Select one of the following options.

To provide feedback,
 tap Suggest an improvement and select
 a feature from the drop down list.

To provide suggestions on the specific
 area,

tap Report a bug and select
 a feature from the drop down list.
To report a fault or error,

tap Attach an image to upload an image if
 needed,

add detailed information
 in the Add Notes box, tap Submit Feedback.
The feedback is submitted.

It will be reviewed by the netradyne team
 to ensure that the appropriate
 action is taken.

For more details, tap the floating
 Help icon in the bottom right corner.

Hi! In this video let us discuss
 how the Driverâ€¢i device works?

Driverâ€¢i devices are dashboard cameras
 that use the latest technologies

in artificial intelligence,
 machine learning and edge computing

for identification and analysis
 to determine the cause of events

that occur with drivers
 during their drive time.

The software analyzes the recorded events
 and generates Alerts, DriverStars,
 and Neutral Events as needed.

The following steps provide a high
 level workflow of the Driver.i Device.

The device captures every driving minute
 of video and sensory data and
 stores it as observations.

While processing the observation
 data, events are classified based

on the Netradyne Proprietary
 artificial Intelligence Algorithms.

Further validations are performed
 on the Events and they are displayed
 on the web portal as alert cards.

The working principle of Driverâ€¢i is based
 on the following steps:

Collecting data,
 interpreting it and acting on it through
 three different sections:

Vision based and inertial data collection
 system consisting of cameras and sensors
Data analytics system using Artificial
Intelligence and Machine Learning.

Assistance to drivers by generating
 alerts and

recognizing drivers based on positive
 driving events.

A safety manager will have access to every
 driving minute captured
 by the Driverâ€¢i device.

They can review the driver's driving
 performances and if needed,

share the alerts with the driver
 as part of their coaching program.

Driverâ€¢i appreciates good driving behavior
 by awarding DriverStars to the driver.

When Driverâ€¢i identifies that an action
 performed by the driver resulted

in avoiding a potential incident,
 a DriverStar is awarded to the driver.

This encourages drivers to follow safe
 driving practices and helps
 enhance fleet safety.

The Driverâ€¢i device generates real time
 alerts for driving events and shares

notifications using both
 Driverâ€¢i app and Driverâ€¢i portal.

The system detects risky events
 and advises coaching sessions
 for drivers for continuous improvement.

Drivers receive GreenZone Score on daily,
 weekly and monthly basis between 1

and 1000, tabulated based on their
 driving habits and behaviors.

Event Access gives access to 100
 hours of stored videos anytime.

For more details, tap the floating
 help icon to view the help content.

Hi! In this video we will discuss about
 the benefits and features

of the Driverâ€¢i App,
 which will allow safety managers to view

and manage the performance
 of their fleet and drivers.

Driverâ€¢i App helps manage
 the fleet and drivers effectively.
It can be accessed from anywhere.

Safety managers can view the details
 of fleet performance,
 drivers, coaching sessions, GreenZone
 statistics and requested videos.

You can download the app
 from Google Play Store or

the Apple App Store based
 on the type of phone you are using.
Driverâ€¢i app provides the following

Performance Visibility,
 Real Time Access,

Coaching,
 Gamification,
 Drive Time Assignment.

Let's explore the various
 sections of the app in detail.

Dashboard- This screen displays the fleet's
 driving performance based on the alerts

and DriverStars generated
 by all the drivers.

The following information is displayed
 on the dashboard

Fleet Average Green Zone Score,
 Notification and Recognition,
 Drivers with highest and lowest score

Most frequent alerts,
 Severe and moderate alerts
 DriverStars Events.

This screen displays
 detailed information about the number
 of alerts generated by the drivers under

each alert type and the number

 in Smart View or Expanded view.

Drivers
 this screen displays information about

your drivers and the number

Hi! In this video,
 let us look in detail at the
 Drivers screen available
on Driverâ€¢i App for Safety Manager.

The Drivers Screen helps you understand
 the performance of drivers in your Fleet

by viewing the alerts generated by them
 and analyzing the driver ranking.

Overspeeding percent represents

generated speeding violation alerts as

and overspeeding percent

including the Green minutes

 of the screen to navigate

of the Driveri App â€“ Safety Manager
 View in detail.

 of the Fleet's driving performance

 of DriverStars awarded to the drivers
 in the selected duration.

 DriverStars to navigate to the
 Events screen

where you can view all
 the alerts and DriverStars.

and then tap Help
 to view the help content.

 View in detail.

Request Video
 Tap Event Access

the active vehicles and placeholder
 vehicles that are
 associated with the devices.

Tap New Request on the top
 right corner of the screen.

The Create new Request
 screen is displayed.

The Video Request quota displays
 the number of videos requested in a month
 versus the monthly quota of videos.

Each minute of video that you
 request is counted as one.

The label color changes from green
 to orange to red depending
 on the number of video requests available.

A breakup of Event Access
 and Alerts Manually fetched video requests
 can be viewed under Usage Account.

Manually requested videos may
 or may not contain alerts.

Event Access videos are manual video
 requests that do not include alerts.

Alerts manually fetched are manual
 video requests that include alerts.

Select the following information
 in the Vehicle Number field.

Search for the vehicle in the drop down
 list or type the vehicle number
 in the Select Date field.

Select the date by tapping
 the Date Picker icon.
In the Start, Time and End Time fields.

Select the duration in which you
 want to request for videos.

Tap Search
 The Add to Cart screen is displayed.

Tap the Add to Cart icon against the
 required videos from the list displayed.

You can also use the Filter and Speed chart
 feature to search for specific videos
 based on the options available.

You can also select Add all to Cart
 to include all the listed videos.
Note: Add to Cart will be disabled if you have exceeded the video quota for the month.

Click Review Cart to review
 the videos added to the cart.

You can review the videos selected and
 remove any unwanted videos from the list.

Tap Submit Request to request
 for the selected videos.

View, Download, Share
 or Convert into Alert.

The requested video screen displays a list
 of video requests that
 are pending and completed.

Tap any of the completed video
 requests to view the video.

Toggle the autoplay videos across minutes
 to automatically play the
 next concurrent minute of the video.
Tap Play all to play all the camera views.

Tap Download Icon and choose
 the preferred camera view.

To download the video,
 Tap the vertical ellipses
to choose the following options.

Tap Share Link to share it as
 full video or trimmed video.

Tap Convert into Alert to convert
 the video into an alert.

This allows you to share it
 with the driver or add it to Coaching.

For more details, tap the floating
 Help icon to view the help content.

Hi! In this video, let us discuss the
 Driver Reports screen

in the Driverâ€¢i App
 Safety Manager View.

Driver Report helps you view the overall
 performance of all drivers at one go.

The reports are generated based on several
 metrics, such as Driver Score,

Total Minutes Analyzed, Green Minutes
 percent and Alerts Impacting score.

You can view the data of all the drivers
 and dive deep into details of
 each driver's performance.

You can request, view, or download
 the report
for a selected time duration.

If required,You can subscribe to the
 report on a weekly or monthly basis

and the report will be sent to your email
 ID

Request Driver Report
 To request the driver report to view and
 analyze the performance of the drivers

in your Fleet based on all or
 specific parameters.

You can subscribe to or generate specific
 reports as and when required.

To request Driver Reports:
 To generate a report for a specific
 Driver Group, tap the Menu icon on Dashboard.

Tap Group and select the
 Driver Group from the list.
Tap the back arrow to return to the menu.
Tap Reports and then tap Driver Reports.

Tap Create Request on the top right corner
 of the Driver Reports screen screen.
The Create Request screen is displayed.

Select the time duration by choosing
 the day, week or month buttons.

You can also use the arrow buttons
 to select required date, week or month.

Select the Report Criteria Tap all drivers
 with a score to generate reports of
 drivers with green zone score.

Tap Custom Filter below all drivers
 with a score to open the custom filters.

The custom filter pop up is displayed
 and you can select the attribute

from the drop down list such as
 Driver Score Total Minutes Analyzed

and Green minutes percent
 and enter the required value.

This will generate the custom
 report for all drivers.
Tap Save to submit the request.

You will receive a notification
 once the report is ready.

The report will be sent
 to your registered email id.

You can also view
 the report on the portal.

To view Driver reports, tap the menu icon
 on the top left corner of the screen.
Tap Reports and then tap Driver Reports.

The requested driver reports
 are displayed on the screen.

Tap the View and Download Reports
 button to view the Fleet Report screen.
Tap View Report or Download as required.

For more details, tap the floating
 Help icon in the bottom right corner.

Hi! Let us discuss the Executive Reports
 in the Driverâ€¢i Appâ€“ Safety Manager View.

Executive Reports summarize the overall
 information about the Fleet and Drivers.

This report provides you an overview
 of your Fleet performance,

Driver Performance Ranking, Risk Profile, Positive Driving,
 and Coaching recommendations.
You can request for the report for a selected time duration
and download and view the report.

You can also subscribe to the report
 on a weekly or monthly basis and the
report will be sent to your email ID.
Request Report To generate report for a specific Driver Group, navigate to Dashboard and tap the Menu icon.
Tap Group and select the Driver Group from the list.
Tap the back arrow to return to the Menu.
Tap Reports and then tap Executive Reports.
Tap the Create Request button on the top right corner of the Executive Reports screen.
The Create Request screen is displayed.
Select the Time Duration by choosing the Week or Month buttons.

You can also use the arrow buttons
 to select required week or month.

Enter a name for the report
 in the Report Name field.
Tap Submit Request.

You will receive a notification
 once the report is ready.

The report will also be sent
 to your registered e-mail id.

You can also view and download
 the report on the portal.
View and Download Executive Reports Tap the Menu icon on the top-left corner of the dashboard screen.
Tap Reports and then tap Executive Reports.

The Executive Reports screen displays
 a list of all the requested reports.
Tap the View and Download Report button to view the report.
Tap the Download icon on the top right corner of the screen to download the report.

For more details, tap the floating
 Help icon in the bottom-right corner.
